thread.title: Jaguars player so concussed he blocked for wrong team
thread.title_full: Jaguars player so concussed he blocked for wrong team | New York Post

author: Jonathan Lehman
title: Jaguars player so concussed he blocked for wrong team
text:
This is NOT how to football: sbnation.com/lookit/2015/10… http://t.co/pQEHHqq8Lj — 
SB Nation (@SBNation) October 12, 2015 
It seemed like one for the blooper reel, but perhaps it was one for the brain trauma textbook?
During the Jaguars’ loss Sunday, reserve running back Bernard Pierce committed an odd special teams gaffe: He turned his back on an opportunity to tackle Bucs punt returner Bobby Rainey and began blocking the Bucs player behind him, as if he were on the return team. Rainey raced by on a 58-yard bring-back.
“I can’t really explain it,” Pierce said Sunday, via the Associated Press. “I really don’t have an answer for it.”
But Jaguars coach Gus Bradley offered a possible explanation Monday when he said, according to SB Nation, Pierce had been evaluated for a concussion .
“When I saw it I couldn’t believe it, but I know he’s in the concussion protocol,” Bradley said. “I know after the game he had concussion symptoms. That’s where I’ll leave it at that, the play itself if you watched it.”
But, wait, in today’s more vigilant NFL, Pierce suffered a concussion before the punt return, but was allowed to re-take the field?
“I don’t know. I imagine so,” Bradley said. “It’s just unfortunate that he had those symptoms and that play happened.”
  concussions ,  jacksonville jaguars
